algorithm_technique: Dynamic programming to calculate minimum costs to reach each stop using either regular or express routes.
problem_summary_simple: Calculate the minimum cost to reach each stop on a train line with two routes and a transfer cost.
problem_summary_technical: DP state dp[i][0] (regular) and dp[i][1] (express) tracks min cost to reach stop i. Transitions consider staying on route or switching.
key_insights: This problem can be solved using dynamic programming where the state represents the minimum cost to reach a stop via either the regular or express route.
The key transitions involve deciding whether to stay on the current route or switch, considering the expressCost for regular-to-express transfers.
The space complexity can be optimized to O(1) by only keeping track of the costs for the previous stop.
